column4: : https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindowss might help you a bit more then the last link i pasted

windows uses the master boot record or mbr to boot into winodws, since ubuntu is a linux system it is unrecognised by windows, as such it need to use a different boot loader to be able to boot a non windows os. you can use grub, which is the back bone of ubuntu booting :P or you could look to find something that maybe you could install from windows.
ill see if i can find something like that for you.....
